SEARCH
Package simu.model

Class MyEngine

java.lang.Object
java.lang.Thread
simu.framework.Engine
simu.model.MyEngine
All Implemented Interfaces:
Runnable
public class MyEngine extends Engine
Core simulation engine for the software development workflow simulation.

This engine models the process of a project moving through different phases: Planning → Implementation → Testing → Review → Presentation. Each phase is represented by a ServicePointController, and customers (representing tasks) flow through them according to stochastic event timing.

Features:

  • Configurable service points for different development roles
  • Randomized processing times using various probability distributions
  • Rollback logic for failed reviews or implementations
  • Support for saving and loading simulation configurations

This class extends Engine and manages the event loop, scheduling, and state transitions of the simulated process.

  • Constructor Details

    • MyEngine

      public MyEngine(SimulatorController controller)
      Service Points and random number generator with different distributions are created here. We use exponent distribution for customer arrival times and normal distribution for the service times.

  • Method Details

    • generateServicePoints

      public void generateServicePoints(int planners, int implementators, int testers, int reviewers, int presenters, long seed, String distribution)
      Generates service points for the simulation with specified numbers of staff for each role, sets the random seed and distribution for timing, and initializes arrival process.
      Parameters:
      planners - Number of planners to simulate.
      implementators - Number of implementers to simulate.
      testers - Number of testers to simulate.
      reviewers - Number of reviewers to simulate.
      presenters - Number of presenters to simulate.
      seed - Seed value for random number generation; if 0, defaults to 1.
      distribution - Name of the distribution to use ("LogNormal", "Normal", or others for Uniform).

    • initialize

      protected void initialize()
      Initializes the simulation by scheduling the first arrival event.
      Specified by:
      initialize in class Engine

    • runEvent

      protected void runEvent(Event t)
      Handles the execution of simulation events as they occur. Processes arrivals and service completions, moving customers through the workflow, including rollback logic for failed implementation or review stages.
      Specified by:
      runEvent in class Engine
      Parameters:
      t - The event to process.

    • tryCEvents

      protected void tryCEvents()
      Attempts to initiate service at any service points that are not currently reserved and have customers waiting in their queue. This method is called repeatedly to progress the simulation.
      Overrides:
      tryCEvents in class Engine

    • results

      protected void results()
      Outputs the final results after the simulation completes. Displays the simulation end time and placeholder text for further result analysis. This method can be extended to include statistical summaries or performance metrics.
      Specified by:
      results in class Engine

    • saveRun

      public void saveRun(int param1, int param2, int param3, int param4, int param5, long seed, long ts, String distribution)
      Persists a simulation run configuration and metadata to the database.
      Parameters:
      param1 - Number of planners used in the run.
      param2 - Number of implementers used in the run.
      param3 - Number of testers used in the run.
      param4 - Number of reviewers used in the run.
      param5 - Number of presenters used in the run.
      seed - Seed value used for random number generation.
      ts - Timestamp of the simulation run.
      distribution - Distribution name used in the simulation.

    • loadRuns

      public List<SimulationRun> loadRuns()
      Loads all previously saved simulation runs from the database.
      Returns:
      A list of SimulationRun entities representing past runs.
